meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #7040.

td.p: Pat Kavanaugh, a marketing content manager from Chicago, Illinois
Tom Imler, a data repair technician from Cary, North Carolina
Kerry Greene, a volunteer guardian ad litem from Manchester, New Hampshire (whose 2-day cash winnings total $42,802)

tr.td: NEW ENDINGS FOR CLASSIC LIT
(Alex: You have to identify the work we have decided to extend.)
TV
MY INTERROGATIVE
20th CENTURY AMERICA
IT'S THE LITTLE THINGS
IN LIFE

Kerry
')

tr.td: Kerry

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: [To Pat] Yes, the Rus.)
...
(Alex: [To Kerry] Yes, she didn\'t spell it, uh, in a way that, uh, we\'re still accepting it, though, because the pronunciation doesn\'t change.)
...
(Alex: One final note before I say good-bye. In the first round of play today, we messed up rather badly in our phrasing of the clue about confirmation and communion in the Roman Catholic faith. Fortunately, it didn\'t affect the outcome. Nevertheless, I do want to apologize for that mistake and promise you that we will do better on Monday.)
PatWhat is Belarus?
$5,000
KerryWhat is Byelorus?
$11,598
TomWhat is Hungary?
$9,300
Belarus')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'A 3-letter 9th century tribe is in the names of 2 21st century countries: the world\'s most vast, & this one')

tr.td: EUROPEAN HISTORY
A 3-letter 9th century tribe is in the names of 2 21st century countries: the world's most vast, & this one
Kerry
Tom
Pat
3-day champion: $66,000
3rd place: $1,000
2nd place: $2,000
Kerry
Tom
Pat

25 R
(including 2 DDs),
4 W
(including 1 DD)

body.div: The J! Archive is created by fans, for fans. The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law. This website is not affiliated with, sponsored by, or operated by Jeopardy Productions, Inc. Join the discussion at JBoard.tv.
